title: NOCSL yet to start Election Process
byline: The current four-year term of the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka (NOCSL) is officially scheduled to end on December 28, 2025.

title: Verstappen Qatar win takes title fight to final race
byline: Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri will contest a final-race championship showdown in Abu Dhabi after Red Bull’s Verstappen won a gripping Qatar Grand Prix.

title: Vegetable prices triple, fish costs double amid supply shortages
byline: The situation was similar at the Peliyagoda fish market, where stocks were scarce. Wholesale prices were reported at Rs. 800 per kilogram for balaya and linna, while salaya was selling at Rs. 600 per kilogram prices of essential food items soared across the country yesterday morning as ongoing adverse weather and disaster conditions severely disrupted supply chains.

title: Several national parks to reopen as weather conditions improve
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Department announced that several national parks temporarily closed due to the recent weather-related national disaster will reopen to visitors from today (December 1).

title: Weather-induced devastation: unfathomable or warnings ignored
byline: Despite forecasts of torrential downpours exceeding 150 mm by the Meteorology Department, the lack of a proper pre-assessment of the potential impact reduced opportunities for damage mitigation this time, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: CAA urges public to report traders charging higher prices
byline: In the wake of the devastating cyclone that caused severe floods and landslides, Sri Lanka is facing a heartbreaking moment as many families struggle to rebuild their lives. Amid the crisis, It was reported that traders selling goods at inflated prices.

title: Floods cost ailing SL economy dearly
byline: In the wake of massive floods that have ravaged one-third of the country, Sri Lanka requires Rs. 31 billion as of November 28 for the restoration of agriculture, irrigation tanks, and damaged canals, according to a communication from the Foreign Ministry.

title: Parliament suspended for 30 minutes for party leaders’ meeting on budget debate amendment
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne suspended Parliament sessions to hold a party leaders’ meeting to decide on amending the committee stage debate on the budget due to the national disaster situation.

title: Namal Rajapaksa launches “Adaraya” to support flood-affected children
byline: In response to helping flood-affected children resume their education by providing the school supplies they urgently need, SLPP National Organizer and parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has launched “Adaraya”, a compassionate initiative aimed at supporting students whose schooling has been disrupted by recent floods and landslides.

title: China provides USD 100,000 in emergency aid to Sri Lanka after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Red Cross Society of China has provided USD 100,000 in emergency cash assistance to the Sri Lanka Red Cross Society to support ongoing relief operations.

title: Five navy personnel who went missing during flood response confirmed dead
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has confirmed that the five naval personnel who went missing during a flood response mission in the Chalai Lagoon have died. The group included the Officer-in-Charge of the Chalai Naval Sub-unit attached to SLNS Wettalekeni.

title: Welikada prison inmates donate today’s lunch to flood affected
byline: The inmates of the Welikada prison have donated their lunch today to the people in Colombo, who were affected by the adverse weather.

title: Understanding the flood aftermath: What Sri Lankans should be aware of now
byline: Sri Lanka is now deep inside a disaster that continues to evolve. Floods have swept through major districts, rivers have crossed dangerous levels, landslides have crushed homes, and thousands have taken shelter in safe centres.

title: Ranil summons all political parties to discuss disaster situation
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe called all opposition parties for a discussion on the current disaster situation, his office said in a statement.

title: Australia pledges AUD 1million aid for Sri Lanka cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Australian Government will provide AUD 1 million in humanitarian assistance to support Sri Lanka’s response to Cyclone Ditwah, the Australian High Commission announced on 30 November 2025.

title: SLAF urges public to refrain from unauthorized drone use during disaster relief operations
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has requested the cooperation of the public when operating drones in areas affected by the ongoing disaster situation. Unregulated drone operations during Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) missions pose significant risks to air operations conducted by the SLAF and other response agencies.

title: Kelani River maintains critical flood level; Residents urged to evacuate
byline: The Kelani River continues to rage at Nagalgam Street, maintaining a critical flood level of 8.45 feet, the Irrigation Department said.

title: Do not return to home until inspections complete: NBRO
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) urged the public not to return to their homes until officials from the NBRO’s District Offices carry out safety inspections and issue their official assessments.

title: Gold prices spike in Sri Lanka as global rates surge
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka recorded a sharp increase today (01) in line with a significant surge in the international market.

title: Security manager at Taj Samudra arrested for assaulting trainees
byline: A security manager at the Taj Samudra hotel in Colombo was arrested yesterday for allegedly assaulting trainee hotel students, police said.

title: Government ignored weather warnings: SJB MP
byline: The Opposition alleged today that the government had not taken precautionary measures to mitigate the devastation caused by the adverse weather despite prior warnings by the Meteorology Department and Irrigation Department of a possible disaster.

title: Deep depression moving away from Sri Lanka
byline: The deep depression in the Bay of Bengal is moving northwards, away from Sri Lanka, and is expected to weaken further, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Death toll climbs to 355; 366 missing in severe weather
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) announced that the death toll from the ongoing adverse weather conditions has risen to 355, while 366 people remain missing.

title: Sri Lanka hit hard: Over 15,000 homes destroyed, 200 roads impassable
byline: According to the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), 998,918 people across all 25 districts of Sri Lanka have been affected by the severe flooding and landslides triggered by Cyclone Ditwah, which made landfall on November 28 before moving back over the Bay of Bengal. The disaster has resulted in 212 deaths and 218 people reported missing.

title: Opposition walks out from Parliament protesting against refusal by ruling party to extend session
byline: The Opposition staged a walkout of Parliament protesting the refusal by the ruling party to allow a full day’s debate on the disaster situation.

title: Parliament session to be suspended tomorrow
byline: Parliamentay sessions will be suspended tomorrow (December 2) due to the national disaster situation, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne announced today.

title: Political truce announced by opposition
byline: Opposition parties yesterday declared a temporary political truce in light of the prevailing flood situation and pledged their full support for ongoing relief efforts.

title: Chamal Rajapaksa gives statement at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Parliamentarian Chamal Rajapaksa arrived at the Bribery Commission this morning (December 1) to provide a statement over an ongoing investigation.

title: Cyclone Ditwah Live Updates in Sri Lanka - Landslides, flood rescues, road closures, rail disruptions and government alerts
byline: Sri Lanka is now confronting one of its gravest natural disasters in recent memory, as Cyclone Ditwah and the resulting weather system continue to unleash relentless rain, flash floods and landslides across the island.

title: Over 100 roads disrupted by floods and landslides: RDA
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) has reported that heavy rainfall and flooding have disrupted transportation on at least 108 roads across the country in recent days.

title: Police urge public to stop sharing false news amid crisis
byline: Strict legal action will be taken against individuals who irresponsibly circulate false or unethical information at a time when the nation is united in responding to the ongoing disaster, police said.

title: Chilaw Hospital shut down after severe flooding
byline: The Chilaw General Hospital has been temporarily closed until further notice after heavy rains triggered severe flooding across the premises.

title: Landslide towns partially accessible
byline: At least one access road has been opened to landslide-affected towns, the Road Development Authority (RDA) Director General, Eng. K.W. Kandamby said.

title: Vegetable stocks arrive; Ministry calls for unhindered transport
byline: The Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation said that large quantities of vegetables are now being collected from key supply regions in the Badulla District, including Welimada and Keppetipola.

title: Over 120,000 home cameras hacked for ’sexploitation’ footage
byline: Four people have been arrested in South Korea for allegedly hacking over 120,000 video cameras in homes and businesses and using the footage to make sexually exploitative materials for an overseas website.

title: Flood-affected residents advised to get free Leptospirosis treatment
byline: The Health and Mass Media Ministry has urged residents affected by recent floods to seek immediate treatment to protect against leptospirosis. People are advised to contact their local Medical Officer of Health or Public Health Inspector to receive a full course of free leptospirosis medication.

title: Former envoy calls for reform of overseas relief donation policy
byline: Former Sri Lankan ambassador Kananathan has called on the government to urgently reform its policy on overseas relief donations, describing current regulations as outdated, restrictive, and obstructive to humanitarian aid.

title: Flood warning for Mahaweli River basin extended by 48 hours
byline: The flood warning issued for the Mahaweli River Basin has been extended for another 48 hours, the Irrigation Department said.

title: Video: Indian NDRF teams conduct rescue operations in Badulla
byline: Teams from India’s National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), the country’s specialised agency for search and rescue and humanitarian assistance and disaster relief (HADR), have carried out rescue operations in Badulla this morning, working in coordination with Sri Lankan authorities.

title: Tulip Siddiq MP given jail sentence in Bangladesh after trial in her absence
byline: Labour MP and former minister Tulip Siddiq has been sentenced to two years in prison in Bangladesh after being put on trial in her absence alongside 16 other people over corruption allegations.

title: One-month grace period for expired driving licences
byline: The Sri Lanka Police announced that no legal action will be taken against motorists driving with expired licences between 25 November and 25 December 2025.

title: Taj Samudra terminates security officer following internal inquiry
byline: Taj Samudra, Colombo, has confirmed that the hotel management has terminated the services of a security officer with immediate effect following an internal inquiry.

title: Affected household to get Rs. 10,000 initial grant to restore sanitation, clean houses
byline: The government will provide Rs. 10,000 as an initial grant to each affected household to restore sanitation and make the home safe for living again, Assistant Secretary of the National Disaster Relief Services Centre (NDRSC), Jayatissa Munasinghe said today.

title: Be vigilant of infectious diseases as floodwaters recede
byline: Assistant Secretary of the National Disaster Relief Services Centre (NDRSC), Jayatissa Munasinghe, urged the public to remain alert to the rising risks of infectious and vector-borne diseases as floodwaters begin to recede across affected areas.

title: Government to import frozen vegetables
byline: The Government has decided to import frozen vegetables that comply with the standards of the Department of Agriculture, Commissioner General of Essential Services B.K. Prabath Chandrakeerthi said today.

title: Legal action to be taken against traders for selling goods at higher prices
byline: The Commissioner General of Essential Services announced today that legal action will be taken against any business or individual who employs unfair or malicious trading practices by increasing prices, unnecessarily hoarding or concealing consumer goods while taking advantage of the current disaster situation.

title: Man shot dead in Chinabay
byline: A 59-year-old man was shot dead by two unidentified men who arrived on a motorcycle at the 5th Mile Post in Chinabay, Trincomalee a short while ago.

title: WHO warning over shortage of obesity jabs
byline: Fewer than one in 10 people who could benefit from obesity jabs like Wegovy are able to get them, warns the World Health Organization as it releases its first guidance on the drugs.

title: Modi holds telephone conversation with Anura Kumara Dissanayake
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a telephone conversation with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake regarding the current situation.

title: ASPI suffers heavy losses amid heightened uncertainty
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange endured a sharp sell-off, as heightened uncertainty stemming from the recent unrest in the country severely dented investor confidence. The market opened on a deeply bearish note, with widespread panic selling dominating early trading. Within the first 30 minutes, the ASPI plunged by over 830 points before recovering nearly 511 points of the initial losses through late-morning bargain hunting.

title: November train season tickets valid until December 7
byline: The Railways Department has announced that the validity period of monthly and quarterly train season tickets for November 2025 has been extended until December 7, 2025.

title: Bangladesh to send relief, rescue team to Sri Lanka
byline: Bangladesh will dispatch emergency relief supplies and a rescue team to disaster-stricken Sri Lanka on December 3, subject to weather conditions, following the directive of the Chief Adviser Professor Dr Muhammad Yunus amid severe floods and landslides caused by Cyclone Ditva.

title: Video: Helicopter wreckage removed after Lunuwila crash
byline: The wreckage of an Air Force Bell 212 helicopter that crashed in the Lunuwila area of Wennappuwa has been removed from the site.

title: New Zealand contributes NZ$ 1 million to support emergency humanitarian relief
byline: New Zealand has contributed New Zealand dollars one million to support emergency humanitarian relief through an international humanitarian partner.

title: Management Committee of ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund appointed
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to establish the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, aimed at rebuilding the country following the severe devastation caused by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’, one of the worst natural disasters in Sri Lanka’s recent history.

title: Adverse weather leaves 366 dead, 367 missing
byline: The nationwide toll from the ongoing adverse weather has surged sharply, with 366 deaths and 367 people reported missing as of 5.00 p.m. today, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: UK provides $890,000 in emergency aid to Sri Lanka after cyclone Ditwah
byline: As Sri Lanka begins to recover from the devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah, the United Kingdom has pledged $890,000 (£675,000) in urgent humanitarian support.

title: Discussion underway with World Bank to assess damage, financial requirements for reconstruction: President
byline: The government has begun discussions with the World Bank to prepare a detailed assessment of the damage across sectors and the financial requirements for reconstruction, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: LPL 2026 gets new July–August dates
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket has confirmed that the sixth edition of the Lanka Premier League will be played from 8 July to 8 August 2026. The revised dates follow the postponement of the tournament, which was initially scheduled for December 2025.

title: Over 120,000 home cameras hacked for ’sexploitation’ footage
byline: Four people have been arrested in South Korea for allegedly hacking over 120,000 video cameras in homes and businesses and using the footage to make sexually exploitative materials for an overseas website.
